channel.title: master on Nadjet's NLP Stuff
channel.description: Recent content in master on Nadjet's NLP Stuff

item.title: Data Science Projects (Q1-2022)
item.description: This first quarter of the 2021-2022 academic year, I supervise 5 final year projects in the Data Science Master of the UOC University, three of which in “general” domains which are 1) argument mining, 2) mining of encyclopedic knowledge from wikipedia, 3) text anonymization, and two of which in applied domains that are 4) use of NLP in an online medical consultation application, and 5) detection of recurrent defects in aircraft safety reports. Below is a selection of the resources and references I give to the students ti get them started (sorry, the bibliographical citations are a bit sloppy).

item.title: Data Science Projects (Q1-2021)
item.description: This first quarter of the 2020-2021 academic year, I supervise 6 final year projects in the Data Science Master of the UOC University, ranging from the development of a COVID-19 FAQ-based Q-A system to building knowledge graphs and performing end-to-end Natural Language Generation. Below is a list of resources and references I offer to get the students started.

item.title: My projects for Data Science Master Students
item.description: Here are the projects I propose to Data Science Master students for their final project this semester. They range from text mining, concept mining, question answering to natural language generation. Most of them will be based on DBPedia/Wikipedia datasets.
